meanings.definition: A hole in a piece of wood where a knot or branch has fallen out.
meanings.sent1: The knothole in the fence allowed me to peek through to the other side.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel peeked out of the knothole in the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: I pretended the knothole was a secret spy window to watch the birds.
meanings.sent4: The knothole in the old barn whispered stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The knothole was like a tiny eye peering into the forest.

meanings.definition: To make a hole in a piece of wood where a knot or branch has fallen out.
meanings.sent1: I carefully knotholed the plank to create a peephole.
meanings.sent2: He knotholes the logs to craft unique birdhouses.
meanings.sent3: She loves to knothole wood to create art pieces.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter knotholed the door for a rustic look.
meanings.sent5: Knotholing the fence added a touch of whimsy to the garden.
